intro: Vernonanthura liatroides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed vernonanthura, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in shrubland and forest margins, preferring well-drained soils. Its ornamental value is appreciated in gardens due to its delicate foliage and fragrant blooms. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small fauna.
